entry.title: All NASA News - NASA
entry.summary: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

entry.title: NASA Ignites New Golden Age of Exploration, Innovation in 2025 - NASA
entry.summary: With a second Trump Administration at the helm in 2025, NASA marked significant progress toward the Artemis II test flight early next year, which is the first

entry.title: NASA Astronaut Jonny Kim to Discuss Eight-Month Space Station Mission - NASA
entry.summary: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim will recap his recent mission aboard the International Space Station during a news conference at 3:30 p.m. EST Friday, Dec. 19, from

entry.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
entry.summary: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

entry.title: Stem Cells, Robotics, and Spacesuits Top Station Crew Day - NASA
entry.summary: Stem cell research, a student robotics challenge, and spacesuit maintenance dominated the schedule aboard the International Space Station on Tuesday. The Expedition 74 crew also rounded out its shift with Earth observations and cargo transfers throughout the day.

entry.title: Advanced Tech and Heart Health Top Monday’s Research Schedule - NASA
entry.summary: Expedition 74 kicked off the week exploring robotics, physics, and heart health aboard the International Space Station. The orbital residents also continued packing a Japanese cargo craft while servicing and inspecting lab hardware.

entry.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
entry.summary: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

entry.title: One of NASA’s Key Cameras Orbiting Mars Takes 100,000th Image
entry.summary: Mesas and dunes stand out in the view snapped by HiRISE, one of the imagers aboard the agency’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

entry.title: NASA, Partners Share First Data From New US-European Sea Satellite
entry.summary: Launched in November, Sentinel-6B will track ocean height with ultraprecision to advance marine forecasting, national security, and more.

entry.title: NASA’s Webb, Curiosity Named in TIME’s Best Inventions Hall of Fame
entry.summary: The most powerful space telescope ever built and the car-size roving science lab on Mars are among 25 of the most iconic inventions the magazine has covered in the past quarter century.

entry.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
entry.summary: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

entry.title: New NASA Sensor Goes Hunting for Critical Minerals
entry.summary: Called AVIRIS-5, it’s the latest in a long line of sensors pioneered by NASA JPL to survey Earth, the Moon, and other worlds.

entry.title: Invention Challenge Brings Student Engineers to NASA JPL
entry.summary: Now in its 26th year, the event brings teams of middle and high school students to the lab to compete with home-built contraptions.

entry.title: NASA Selects 2 Instruments for Artemis IV Lunar Surface Science
entry.summary: The JPL-led South Pole Seismic Station will enable scientists to characterize the lunar interior structure to better understand geologic processes that affect planetary bodies.

entry.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
entry.summary: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

entry.title: November 2025 Company Update
entry.summary: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. entry.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
entry.summary: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

entry.title: October 2025 Company Update
entry.summary: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. entry.summary: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch.
